title: Suvarnadurg Fort
subtitle: The Golden Sea Fort of Konkan
overview: Suvarnadurg Fort, situated off the coast of Harnai in Dapoli taluka, is one of Maharashtra’s most impressive sea forts. Originally built by the Adil Shahi rulers and later strengthened by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, the fort symbolized Maratha naval strength.

The fort, whose name means 'Golden Fort', once served as a key defense post for the Maratha Navy under Kanhoji Angre. Its scenic island location and surrounding blue waters make it a must-visit heritage spot in Konkan.

highlights.title: Sea Fort Legacy
highlights.description: Built on an island in the Arabian Sea, Suvarnadurg is accessible only by boat from Harnai jetty and offers a glimpse into Maratha maritime history.

highlights.title: Golden Heritage
highlights.description: The fort’s name, meaning ‘Golden Fort’, reflects its importance as a naval base during the reign of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

geography.intro: Located on a rocky island just off Harnai port, Suvarnadurg is surrounded by turquoise waters and connected to the mainland by short boat rides.

details.label: Location
details.value: Off Harnai coast, Dapoli, Ratnagiri District

details.label: Built By
details.value: Adil Shahi Dynasty, later fortified by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj

climate.description: The Konkan coast has a humid tropical climate with moderate to heavy rainfall during monsoon.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: November to February
Avoid monsoon season (June to September) due to rough seas

geography.conclusion: The combination of the rugged island terrain and breathtaking sea views makes Suvarnadurg a truly unique fort experience.

activities.title: Boat Ride Adventure
activities.description: Take a thrilling boat ride from Harnai jetty to reach the fort.
info: Local fishermen offer short rides to the fort island.
Check weather and tide schedules before planning.

activities.title: Photography & Sightseeing
activities.description: The fort’s elevated ramparts offer panoramic sea views and sunsets.
info: Ideal for landscape and heritage photography.
Sunset views over the Arabian Sea are breathtaking.

activities.title: Exploration Walk
activities.description: Wander through ancient gates, bastions, and fort walls that whisper tales of Maratha naval glory.
info: Watch your step on rocky paths during monsoon.

attractions.title: Kanakdurg Fort
attractions.description: The mainland twin of Suvarnadurg, located directly opposite Harnai port. Offers views of Suvarnadurg island.
attractions.value: Historic twin fort on the mainland

attractions.title: Anjarle Ganpati Temple
attractions.description: A beautiful seaside temple dedicated to Lord Ganesh, located near Dapoli.

marineLife.intro: The Harnai coast is known for rich marine biodiversity and regular dolphin sightings.

items.title: Dolphins
items.description: Boat operators often spot playful dolphins around Harnai and Anjarle.

items.title: Coral and Marine Fish
items.description: The shallow coastal waters are home to small coral formations and tropical fish.

conclusion: Visitors can enjoy dolphin-watching tours organized by local fishermen.
Marine diversity adds to the beauty of the Konkan coastal experience.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Dapoli is about 230 km from Mumbai and 190 km from Pune.
Harnai port, the access point for Suvarnadurg, is 15 km from Dapoli.

howToReach.title: By Rail & Air
details: Nearest railway station: Khed (40 km) on Konkan Railway.
Nearest airport: Ratnagiri (130 km) or Pune (200 km).

bookingTips.description: Plan your visit during winter (November–February) for pleasant weather.
Boat rides depend on tide and weather—confirm availability in advance.
Stay in Dapoli or Harnai for convenient access to the fort and nearby beaches.
